messages.content: not as strong, but I usually use it in tandem with lots of costly cards so it gets value almost every draw

i just play cards
It really doesn't take much
it takes me clicking on the draw pile before playing the card
and i have a bad habit of checking my discard pile

Grudge is very solid, it counts the memento from your starting relic, so it's baseline 11 AOE damage for 1 energy, which compares fantastically to cleave and dagger spray. The upgrade is very rarely worth it, you would need to be both very curse heavy, and not have many ways to exhaust the curses (which does lower the damage of grudge). You can pair it with memento's retain to deal 16 AOE damage for 1 energy. On top of all that, AOE is very useful against the 2 hardest hallway fights in act 1 (slime gang, gremlin gang), tri-sentries, and slime boss. It really shines in act 2 as most hallway fights involve 2+ enemies, and 2 of 3 elite fights involve multiple enemies. I would almost never pass up grudge in the first half of the run. It's also much easier to use than hermit's other AOE cards, as no holds barred has a nasty drawback, malice requires having a curse to exhaust alongside it, and the other 2 are rares and are thus much harder to find. It can even scale into good burst damage in single target fights if you have a curse heavy deck.
<attack bruise energy less>

embeds.title: No Holds Barred
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 19 (23) damage and apply 5 (6) **Bruise** :p_bruise: to ALL enemies.
Gain 1 less :e_hermit: next turn.

footer.text: <attack bruise energy less> = no holds barred, 72% sure

messages.content:
wait it does?
so on a10+ it should be 13 damage for 1 energy
which is better than cleave+
until it exhausts

Yes, it counts any curse that's in your deck, hand, or discard. Exhausted curses will not count. Ascenders' bane does count if you can draw your grudge before it exhausts, which is absolutely excellent damage for 1 energy roughly half the time
apparently grudge's scaling behavior was just changed in the most recent patch. I'm not sure how, but It probably works somewhat differently now, so my information is no longer accurate
